Date   : 14.9.2006 
 
 
C I R C U L A R  17/ 2006 
 
 
Sub: Prevention of misuse/ unauthorized sale of low fare tickets by APSU/ 
Airlines staff etc. at Indian airports. 
 
It has been brought to the notice of this Bureau that low fare air tickets 
issued in the form of flight-coupons in jacket or e-tickets have been misused on 
occasions. 
 
2. 
Since there is considerable potentials for misuse of such low fare tickets, 
which may constitute threat to civil aviation security, the following instructions are 
issued for implementation with immediate effect: 
 
(i) 
No boarding card shall be issued to the passenger by the 
concerned airlines unless reliable identity of the passenger is 
established by the concerned agencies. 
(ii) 
Verification of identity in respect of low fare passengers 
tickets under all schemes other than normal fare tickets shall 
be the responsibility of the concerned airlines. 
(iii) 
Passenger shall be responsible to keep reliable Identity 
proof with him throughout the journey, which can be checked 
at any point of time. 
(iv) 
Such instructions should be prominently written on the 
jacket/ e-ticket itself. The passenger shall carry on their 
person proof of his identity.  
(v) 
The dealing official at the check in counter shall write and 
stamp “Identity verified through ….. (name of the document) 
….. and on the copy enclosed with flight coupon”. 
(vi) 
Security staff of APSU/ ASG will also check the identity of 
low fare passenger at security check  point. 
 
 
(D.S. Chauhan) 
Addl. Commissioner of Security (CA)
